discussion.content: Add-ins deployed via the admin center are available to users in their Office applications right away, with no client configuration required.
Correct. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/office/dev/add-ins/publish/centralized-deployment

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
You have a Microsoft SharePoint Online subscription.
You need to create a PowerShell script to retrieve planned changes and service information from Microsoft 365.
How should you complete the PowerShell script? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:

discussion.content:
Upload the App to the App Catalog site
Add the app to the App catalog site
On the Manage App Deployments page, configure the site collection.

Actions
ㆍUpload th app to the App Catalog Site.
ㆍOn the Manage App Deployments page, configure the site collection.
ㆍIn the managed Paths section, configure the site collection.
ㆍAdd the app to the App Catalog site.
ㆍCreate a subsite in the App Catalog site collection

you must first upload it to the App Catalog site
On the App Catalog site, go to SettingsOffice 365 Settings button and then click Add an app.
Select the app you want to add, and click Trust It when prompted.
Click the ellipses ( ...) next to the app, Click the ellipses ( ...) again in the callout to view the menu, and then click Deployment.
On the Manage App Deployments page, type the URL for each site collections to which you want to deploy the app, and then click Add to add it to the list.
In the Managed Paths section use the Add button to specify which managed paths should have this app available.
In the Site Templates section, use the Add button to specify which site templates should have this app available.
Click OK.
If you are prompted to Trust the app, click Trust It.

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
Your company has a Microsoft SharePoint Online subscription.
The company develops a new SharePoint app.
You need to ensure that the app is available automatically to users in a specific site collection without requiring the users to install the app.
You create an App Catalog site collection.
Which three actions should you perform in sequence next? To answer, move the appropriate actions from the answer area and arrange them in the correct order.
Select and Place:

choices.C: The Sharing settings in the SharePoint admin center
choices.D: the Site usage page in Site1
choices.A: the Data governance dashboard in the Security & Compliance admin center
choices.B: the usage report in the Microsoft 365 admin center

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft SharePoint Online site named Site1.
You are monitoring the usage patterns of the site collection.
What should you use to identify which files were shared to external users?

discussion.content: I disagree with this answer. You can see the volume of externally shared items from the central usage report but you cannot appear to determine the exact files. You can do this from the usage report from within the site collection itself so I think the correct answer here is D
ans is D as the question is asking which files and not how many?
I think should be A.

D is correct. The questions wants to know WHICH files, not quantity etc.
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/admin/activity-reports/sharepoint-site-usage?view=o365-worldwide
https://www.c-sharpcorner.com/article/how-to-manage-externally-shared-contents-in-sharepoint-online/
D isn't complete answer. Site contents>site usage
D is correct answer
I agree with LeeDrinkwater. The question also talks about site usage pattern. D is the correct answer.

choices.B: Create a conditional access policy that allows access from managed devices.
choices.A: Set Allow limited access to Allow downloading.
choices.C: Create a conditional access policy to block access from unmanaged mobile and desktop clients.
choices.D: Set Allow limited access to Block downloading.
choices.E: Create a conditional access policy for web browsers that has app-enforced restrictions.

comments.content:
Yes, Correct options are 
CDE
1st we need to block access from any mobile/desktop client apps using conditional access policy in Azure AD
Then 2nd conditional access policy is to make browser app enforced restiction in Azure AD
Block download (Allow limited access) for unmanged devicesfrom SharePoint access control

discussion.content:
B. Create a conditional access policy that allows access from managed devices.
Shouldn't this say unmanaged devices?

Actually, the highlighted answers are correct; the question doesn't mention anything about specific device types, it only specifies 'unmanaged'. 
Conditional Access Policy; the condition in this case being the device to be managed.

It cannot be C, "unmanaged mobile and desktop clients."
You do not want to block the Desktop clients.

questions.question_text:
Your company uses Microsoft SharePoint Online and Microsoft OneDrive for Business to store documents.
You need to prevent users from downloading the SharePoint and OneDrive documents from unmanaged devices. The users must be able to edit the documents from a web browser on the unmanaged devices.
Which three actions should you perform? Each correct answer presents part of the solution?
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
